definition: scroll/book/volume/chapter/examination paper/classifier for books, paintings: volume, scroll
to roll up/roll/classifier for small rolled things (wad of paper money, movie reel etc)
to roll (up)/to sweep up/to carry on/roll
flag used as a shop sign/variant of 簾|帘[lian2]

gate/door/CL:扇[shan4]/gateway/doorway/CL:個|个[ge4]/opening/valve/switch/way to do something/knack/family/house/(religious) sect/school (of thought)/class/category/phylum or division (taxonomy)/classifier for large guns/classifier for lessons, subjects, branches of technology/(suffix) -gate (i.e. scandal; derived from Watergate)

sentences.english: Followed by plainclothes police and reporters will be pulled into the roller shutter door entertainment city.
sentences.chinese: 随后便衣民警和记者将卷帘门拉起进入了游乐城。

sentences.english: He has installed an automatic rolling door in his own store.
sentences.chinese: 他为自己的店门装配上了自动的卷帘门。

sentences.english: I saw the shutter doors closed, the door did not light the first of the light box.
sentences.chinese: 只见卷帘门关着，门头的灯箱也没亮。

sentences.english: With PLC, variable-frequency drives, light curtains, roll-up doors.
sentences.chinese: 该产品配有PLC，变频驱动器，光幕，卷帘门。

definition: to close a door/to lock a door/(of a shop etc) to close (for the night, or permanently)
customer area of a store/showroom/dining area of a restaurant
car door/door of bus, railway carriage etc
